name: The Fool
imagery: White lilies symbolize a pure heart; the multicolored clothes show inner turbulence; the barking dog and the cliff signal coming danger; the laurel means victory; the staff is the Fool’s perceived power.
themes: Fearlessness, desire to win, confidence, staying true to yourself, crisis, adventure, innocence, freedom

meanings.upright: Let go of the past / start again / a carefree new romance
meanings.reversed: Refusing change / overconfidence / relationship feels heavy / bound and restricted

name: The Magician
imagery: The four elements are all present on the table, yet the Magician looks upward, focusing on spirit and soul.
themes: Wisdom, ability, valuing spirit, confidence, infinite power, turning ideas into reality

meanings.upright: Communication flows easily / time to start a new relationship
meanings.reversed: Unequal communication / lack of creativity / boredom / uncertainty

name: The High Priestess
imagery: The black pillar represents intuition; the white pillar represents what already exists; the crescent moon shows quietness and meticulous thought.
themes: Intuition, sensitivity, imagination, divinity, strength, calmness, mystery

meanings.upright: Clear understanding / ability to plan ahead / detached behavior / spiritual rewards
meanings.reversed: Passivity / lack of thought / confusion about the future / emotional instability

name: The Empress
imagery: Her beautiful crown and amulet symbolize strong life force and nurturing power.
themes: Gentleness, nobility, harvest, immersion, material abundance

meanings.upright: Enjoyment of love / pregnancy / favorable external conditions
meanings.reversed: Dissatisfaction in love / relationship stagnation / lack of growth / imbalance of resources

name: The Emperor
imagery: The cross and orb symbolize divine grace and personal power; tiptoes suggest readiness to stand.

meanings.upright: One partner has strong control / disciplined / self-control
meanings.reversed: Loss of control / lack of discipline / overcontrol / third-party interference

name: The Hierophant
imagery: Right hand raised, left hand lowered, connecting heaven and earth; followers kneel below.
themes: Religion, truth, spirituality, pursuit of wisdom

meanings.upright: Marriage / help from others / follow advice / spiritual connection
meanings.reversed: Rebellion / refusal of help / act by own will / deception

name: The Lovers
imagery: The man looks at the woman, the woman looks at the divine; the sun above symbolizes the future.
themes: Fulfillment, happiness, blessing, choice, turning point

meanings.upright: Romance / decision
meanings.reversed: Breakup / third party / unclear intentions

name: The Chariot
imagery: Represents the god of war; black lion for severity, white lion for compassion; symbolizes pursuit of victory.
themes: Impulse, aggression, victory, willpower, control, search for balance

meanings.upright: Control and balance / rationality over emotions
meanings.reversed: Emotions overpower rationality / loss of control

name: Strength
imagery: The woman symbolizes inner strength; the lion represents raw energy.

meanings.upright: Inner strength / female empowerment / passion
meanings.reversed: Weakness / lack of courage / avoidance / loss of control

name: The Hermit
imagery: Absence of bright colors shows solitary thought; the lamp symbolizes truth.

meanings.upright: Rationality / secret admiration / spiritual depth
meanings.reversed: Suspicion / isolation / loneliness / lack of self-reflection

name: Wheel of Fortune
imagery: Four corners represent four elements; inner triangle the three divine beings; outer ring time, inner ring space.

meanings.upright: Control over fate / luck / unexpected opportunity / change
meanings.reversed: Manipulated by others / misfortune / stagnation / fading passion

name: Justice
imagery: Goddess Athena; sword symbolizes judgment, scales represent fairness; poised for action.

meanings.upright: Balanced relationship / honesty / marriage
meanings.reversed: Third-party interference / disloyalty / unfairness

name: The Hanged Man
imagery: Hung on a cross, his situation tragic, but his heart is joyful; one foot for physical trial, one for spiritual joy.

meanings.upright: Misunderstanding / sacrifice / selfless devotion
meanings.reversed: Unequal relationship / fruitless effort / recklessness

name: Death
imagery: The king resists and dies; the priest embraces spirit; woman begs for mercy; child offers flower to Death.

meanings.upright: Deepening estrangement / breakup / destruction for renewal
meanings.reversed: Reconciliation / resistance to change / stagnation

name: Temperance
imagery: Contradictory yet harmonious; foot on land and water symbolizes balance; angel moderates two worlds.

meanings.upright: Emotional resonance / balance in love / open-mindedness / communication
meanings.reversed: Indecision / imbalance / lack of harmony / third-party disruption

name: The Devil
imagery: The devil represents lust and temptation; chains symbolize bondage and submission.

meanings.upright: Dominated by desire / manipulation / entrapment
meanings.reversed: Lack of intimacy / separation / departure / resisting temptation

name: The Tower
imagery: The tower symbolizes human arrogance, punished by divine wrath; collapse represents downfall.

meanings.upright: Breakup / external disruption / unavoidable change
meanings.reversed: Impending breakup / forced change / failure to overcome weaknesses

name: The Star
imagery: Pouring water symbolizes nurturing and renewal.
themes: Good fortune, peace, purity, hope, opportunity

meanings.upright: Bright future / hope / progress / potential
meanings.reversed: Unrealistic / hopelessness / melancholy / confusion

name: The Moon
imagery: A dangerous road; animals howl in unease; the moon’s melancholy face reflects anxiety.

meanings.upright: Confusion / unclear path / false relationship / insecurity
meanings.reversed: Clarity emerges / reconciliation / truth revealed

name: The Sun
imagery: The sun spreads warmth and joy; a child rides a horse happily.

meanings.upright: Love / marriage / public relationship / bright future
meanings.reversed: Decline in passion / separation / lack of motivation

name: Judgement
imagery: An angel sounds the horn; souls rise; the call drives self-recognition.

meanings.upright: Positive transformation / awakening / reunion
meanings.reversed: Need for reflection / deception / jealousy

name: The World
imagery: Four corners represent divine beings, paralleling the Wheel of Fortune, but signifying completion.

meanings.upright: Best partnership / unity / blessing / eternity
meanings.reversed: Unclear ending / temporary / suffering / ambiguity
